adjective.description: (especially of sound, taste, and color) pleasantly smooth or soft; free from harshness.
examples: she was hypnotized by the mellow tone of his voice
slow cooking gives the dish a sweet, mellow flavor

adjective.description: (of a person's character) softened or matured by age or experience.

examples: fuller-flavored whiskeys mellow with wood maturation
getting older does mellow the hard edges around the anger

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense ripe, sweet, and juicy): perhaps from attributive use of Old English melu, melw- (see meal). The verb dates from the late 16th century.
